intro: Ptychomeria portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican ptychomeria, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas. It has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
